div.em: Current conditions as of 19 Apr 21:55 pm CDT

div.div: A 30 percent chance of showers, mainly after 3am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 41. North northeast wind around 5 mph becoming calm after midnight. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch possible.

A 30 percent chance of showers, mainly before 8am. Mostly cloudy, then gradually becoming sunny, with a high near 66. Breezy, with a light and variable wind becoming west northwest 13 to 18 mph in the morning. Winds could gust as high as 32 mph. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch possible.
Mostly clear, with a low around 37. Breezy, with a northwest wind 13 to 18 mph decreasing to 7 to 12 mph after midnight. Winds could gust as high as 28 mph.

font.marquee: 4/17/2020 ANNOUNCEMENT: SCHOOL CLOSED THROUGH END OF SCHOOL YEAR -- ALL ACTIVITIES & BUILDING USE CANCELLED OR POSTPONED DURING THIS TIME

span.span: Treynor’s Book Fair is open online beginning April 19th! Visit the Scholastic website for Treynor April 19th through 26th and shop for new books. This is for all ages, not just elementary and middle school. Now is the perfect time to buy books!

span.span: A message from our homes to yours because we know being away from our Nest for this long is a challenge. Stay connected with us and keep on learning, Cardinals! We are Treynor. We are Treynor Strong. #RollCards

a.aria-label: Read more about A Message from Treynor MS/HS

h3.a: School Closure Extended for the Remainder of the School Year

span.span: Iowa Governor Kim Reynolds has determined that Iowa schools should remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Therefore, the Treynor Community School will remain closed until the last scheduled day of the school year, Friday, May 29. All school events, activities, and practices are cancelled during the school closure.

We can all agree that the last several weeks have been some of the most difficult that we have endured as a school community. One of the issues we have struggled with the most is how to ensure that students have an opportunity to continue learning, while also respecting the varied and unique situations that affect many of our students and families.

To help reconcile learning with the well-being of our students and families, we have chosen to offer voluntary education opportunities for K-12 students. Since the initial closure, our teachers have provided a variety of learning and enrichment activities, and they will continue to provide these opportunities for the remainder of the closure. While these activities are not “required learning,” we strongly encourage parents and families to support participation while students are at home. We want all students to stay engaged in learning as much as possible. Keep on learning, Treynor!
Stay healthy…stay strong!
Up-to-date information on COVID-19 in Iowa can be found at
or follow IDPH on Facebook at @IowaDepartmentofPublicHealth and Twitter at @IAPublicHealth.

a.aria-label: Read more about School Closure Extended for the Remainder of the School Year

span.span: The Treynor Elementary Staff misses each and every one of you!

a.aria-label: Read more about A Message from Treynor Elementary

div.p: Construction on the new bus barn and high school addition continues despite school being closed. The construction workers remain outside and practice their standards for safety and sanitation during this time. The new transportation facility building is mostly complete. There are a few details and equipment that need finalized before the okay is given to move into the facility. The high school addition is progressing nicely. Check out the video highlighting the updates. All move-in and completion dates are tentative and subject to change.

The Facility Bond Election passed by over 80% on September 11, 2018. The web article in regards to the bond election and original FAQs can be referenced here. Construction plan documents are available for review below:
Past updates can be found on the Facility Construction Archived article.

span.span: Our goal during the school closure is to keep all students engaged in learning! We strongly encourage students to take full advantage of the learning opportunities provided by our teachers. At this time, the online learning opportunities are voluntary. Student work can be submitted for teacher review, but the work will not be formally graded. Even though the learning opportunities are voluntary, we encourage all students to KEEP ON LEARNING! Also, we ask parents to help us in this endeavor!

Grades K-5: Early last week, all parents received an email or letter from their child's teacher describing grade-level specific learning opportunities and activities along with some general guidance on completion. Teachers have also communicated their contact information and available times to answer any questions parents or students may have. Parents, please continue to check email and this website for additional information regarding future packet pickups and any changes that may occur to enhance students' home learning experience. If you have any questions please contact your child's teacher or Ms. Kay by email jkay@treynorcardinals.org or phone 712-487-3414 ext 1127.
Grades 6-12
: A

ll 6-12 teachers will be using Google Classroom for all of their classes, and they will be posting two learning opportunities for each class every week. They will also hold office hours through Google Meet twice a week. During
, students can connect with their teachers, ask questions, and discuss the learning opportunities.

Parents will receive an email inviting them to receive weekly summaries from Google Classroom. If you wish to change those notifications to daily summaries, you can do that by following the directions here.
Thank you for your understanding and patience as we learn this new process. As we get started, we will work together to adjust and communicate as needed.
If you need home internet in the Treynor area, there are a few resources linked below for your convenience:
Treynor High School's parking lot has WiFi access, if a student needs to sit in their car to upload or download information.
The Treynor Community Center parking lot has WiFi access during this time. Access code is 5157551575

We'd love to see pictures of your children learning at home. If you post to Facebook or Twitter, add the hashtag #KeepOnLearningTreynor so we can find them. This is an unprecedented time in history and we want to capture these moments.

a.aria-label: Read more about Keep on Learning, Treynor!

div.p:
The TeamMates Program is in its first year at Treynor CSD and will begin with 3rd and 6th grade students. We are in need of mentors for this program. Please consider applying. Read more about the program below.
What is TeamMates?
The mission of TeamMates is to positively impact the world by inspiring youth to reach their full potential through mentoring.
Tom and Nancy Osborne founded the TeamMates Mentoring Program in 1991 in an effort to provide support and encouragement to school aged youth. The goal of the program is to see youth graduate from high . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Treynor CSD TeamMates

div.p:
WEEKLY NEWS BULLETIN
We send this picture message from our homes to yours, because we know being away from our Nest for this long is a challenge. Stay connected with us and keep on learning, Cardinals! We are Treynor. We are Treynor Strong. #RollCards
Treynor’s Book Fair is open online beginning on April 19th! Visit the Scholastic website for Treynor April 19th-26th and shop for new books. This is for all ages, not just elementary and middle school. Now is the perfect time to buy books!
Treynor Prom, A Night in Vegas , has been moved to June 27th. Because of availability of venues, the dinner and dance will be held at the school. A form has been sent to juniors and seniors to complete with their intention of attending prom and whether or not they are bringing a date. We hope all juniors and seniors plan on joining us for a wonderful evening!
Check the Treynor Elementary Facebook page for the “Question of the Day . . .
